intro: Cryptandra alpina, commonly known as the alpine cryptandra, is a small shrub native to the alpine regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Cryptandra alpina plays an important role in stabilizing soil in alpine ecosystems and provides habitat for native wildlife.
